initial_story:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.
stories:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander has been busy preparing for the Eurovision Song Contest since he was announced as the UK's entrant in February.

The singer-songwriter, who is best known as the lead singer of the band Years & Years, has been working on his song, Dizzy, which he will perform at the competition in Malmo, Sweden.

Alexander has been keeping his fans updated on his preparations for the competition on social media, sharing pictures and videos of himself in rehearsals.

He has also been giving interviews to the media, in which he has spoken about how he is feeling ahead of the big night.

"I'm just trying to enjoy it," Alexander told the BBC. "I'm not thinking about the pressure or anything like that. I'm just trying to have fun and do my best."

The Eurovision Song Contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Alexander has been keeping his fans updated on his preparations for the competition on social media, sharing pictures and videos of himself in rehearsals.

He has also been giving interviews to the media, in which he has spoken about how he is feeling ahead of the big night.

"I'm just trying to enjoy it," Alexander told the BBC. "I'm not thinking about the pressure or anything like that. I'm just trying to have fun and do my best."

The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander has been busy preparing for the Eurovision Song Contest since he was announced as the UK's entrant in February.

The singer-songwriter, who is best known as the lead singer of the band Years & Years, has been working on his song, Dizzy, which he will perform at the competition in Malmo, Sweden.

Alexander has been keeping his fans updated on his preparations for the competition on social media, sharing pictures and videos of himself in rehearsals.

He has also been giving interviews to the media, in which he has spoken about how he is feeling ahead of the big night.

"I'm just trying to enjoy it," Alexander told the BBC. "I'm not thinking about the pressure or anything like that. I'm just trying to have fun and do my best."

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander has been busy preparing for the Eurovision Song Contest since he was announced as the UK's entrant in February.

The singer-songwriter, who is best known as the lead singer of the band Years & Years, has been working on his song, Dizzy, which he will perform at the competition in Malmo, Sweden.

Alexander has been keeping his fans updated on his preparations for the competition on social media, sharing pictures and videos of himself in rehearsals.

He has also been giving interviews to the media, in which he has spoken about how he is feeling ahead of the big night.

"I'm just trying to enjoy it," Alexander told the BBC. "I'm not thinking about the pressure or anything like that. I'm just trying to have fun and do my best."
